website_summaries.verdict: A beautiful instrument that suits several styles of music very well, including Celtic and Cajun music.
pros: A decently priced concertina with a beautiful sound

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this, this thing is a toy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this! I can’t stress enough how poor quality this is. 2 things happened within 15 minutes of playing this thing. 1) reed got stuck (‘e’ on right hand) 2) upon trying to loosen and tighten screw around thumb grip, the screw and mount cane completely out of the concertina!!! Also extremely hard to even get a grip on in the first place. The sound is OK, but not really even close to an intermediate concertina. Do not buy this! You’re probably better off with a cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: romulus mihalteanu

customer_reviews.title: Fine Starter Instrument
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a starter instrument; I've had it for three days and it plays in-tune and clearly. The bellows are a tad stiff, but after 3 hard days of pounding away at the thing it's getting easier to work with. The lower notes are not very responsive (par for the course, esp. for the money) and the 5th button on the left hand accidental row has a rattle on the push, but it'll do just fine for any beginner or somebody wanting to move from a smaller instrument to a 30-key on a budget. TL;DR: Works great for what it is: a starter concertina.
customer_reviews.author: Cam E

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful concertina. The price was right it plays perfectly. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Ward Kiel

customer_reviews.title: For the price of this concertina we thought we were getting a good one, but the workmanship was shoddy and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Two buttons stuck on first use and could not be reset. For the price of this concertina we thought we were getting a good one, but the workmanship was shoddy and it was obvious on examining the design that the buttons will inevitably get stuck and cannot be popped back out.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: One of the keys on the second row, right ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the keys on the second row, right hand last key on second row did not play the note when pushed in. Sorry I'm late posting this but I only started trying to learn the concertina recently. Any way this can be repaired? I'm thinking of ordering a second one but need assurance all of the keys will work.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Squitieri

customer_reviews.title: Not sure whether it's worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: This sounds terrible unless you know how to play it. When she learns, I'll come back and update.
customer_reviews.author: dsegn

customer_reviews.title: Too bad I didn't get one that worked
customer_reviews.text: Went through 2 of these, the first had a button that kept getting stuck. The second had a button that didn't play. Too bad I didn't get one that worked. Got to give amazon praise for the hassle free returns. I think if your lucky and get a good one that it would be a good instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Phil White

customer_reviews.title: NOT SO MUCH
customer_reviews.text: I like that it was economical Ana seemed to me that my grandkids might like to play around and learn to make music with it, but not so far! Has anyone else been happy with their purchase?
customer_reviews.author: DebM

customer_reviews.title: Finally he takes a break from video games!!
customer_reviews.text: My 17 year old son cant seem to put this down. He practices every night. I love that he is into different instruments.
customer_reviews.author: "T"

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Concertina
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent concertina at an affordable price. I have been playing it every day since I bought it and have had no issues with keys sticking or not working. The sound is also wonderful and I haven't noticed any wheezing sounds when playing. A definate buy for anyone interested in a 30 button Ango concertina.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer and Matt

customer_reviews.title: I mean like why? Why not?
customer_reviews.text: Well, the sticky keys get fixed with sand paper And wd40. Been playing a bit and it’s pretty fun. Now though, I’m wondering, why did i buy this? Sure it’s neat and challenging. But like, when would this be useful? Dunno. Good cheap instrument. Fun to learn, sounds...like an accordion. So. Yeah. Fixable problems if you know how a button works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good entry to the concertina
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine now for about 6 months, with fairly regular playing, and it continues to play well. I was looking for an inexpensive start on the concertina. I dived in, in spite of some of the reviews here, and my experience has been a good one. The only real complaint so far has been the original straps, which were hard to adjust and made of something that masqueraded as leather (or was the thinnest leather ever). Each has been replaced once with a tougher material. Otherwise, I have had no issues with the instrument that others have cited, such as buttons sticking.
customer_reviews.author: TSSN

customer_reviews.title: Good WORK KEEP U THANKS YOU VERY MUCH
customer_reviews.text: THANKS U Very much LOVE IT GOD BLESSED YOU'RE FAMILY

customer_reviews.title: Does not appear to exist.
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived it was not a concertina, but a cheap bathroom light fixture. When I tried to exchange it Amazon said the concertina was not available, so I returned it for a refund. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Crawford Campbell

customer_reviews.title: OK for the money
customer_reviews.text: The hand straps are way too big. It is a little stiff pulling apart. But one of the buttons did not work and had to send it back. But for the price, it was not a bad deal.

customer_reviews.title: Our daughter had never heard of a concertina. She ...
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter had never heard of a concertina. She loves it and has learned to play it quite well.

customer_reviews.title: Came in working order
customer_reviews.text: It is a well made instrument with few flaws. Some of the buttons feel off but it works just fine.

customer_reviews.text: While the product is well crafted and stunning to play, my dogs hate it. I will be practicing when I am away from them, good product and worth the money

customer_reviews.title: ... more snug (as others report having to do) I love this instrument
customer_reviews.text: Other than having to punch another hole in the straps to make the fit more snug (as others report having to do) I love this instrument!

customer_reviews.title: Now having fun!
customer_reviews.text: Had a couple if sticking buttons. Sent it back and no problems. Buttonscare stiff till its been played a bit. Process of return and replacement was fabulous. Now having fun!

customer_reviews.title: My new hobby!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after hearing a folk singer play one (beautifully). I wanted to make my own music. This will take some work, but it's proving to be all kinds of fun!

customer_reviews.title: This is the second concertina I purchased and again there ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second concertina I purchased and again there is a problem with one of the buttons - right hand, second row third key for which there is a delay. The original one I purchased one of the buttons did not sound which I noted in that review. Any comments would be helpful. Toby Squitieri Leonia, NJ
customer_reviews.author: Toby Squitieri

customer_reviews.title: sorta like something you'd win at a state fair
customer_reviews.text: Very low quality, sorta like something you'd win at a state fair. If it was priced at about $15 to $20 range, I'd recommend it, but not for $100+.

customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a well made concertina. Nice sound. Now all I have to do is learn to play it.

customer_reviews.title: This concertina which I have had for a month works ...
customer_reviews.text: This concertina which I have had for a month works exelent though the straps for the hands is a little large.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: great product. just the way i thought it will be. the shipping was very fast. it looks like in the picture it was a fair price

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas and he just loves it! He already learned how to play it! My musical genius! :) Thank you for making such a quality product! :)
customer_reviews.author: Gisellemommie

customer_reviews.title: Ugh! Buttons Stick!!
customer_reviews.text: I've now returned this twice, and Amazon won't replace it again, so I guess it was a complete bust. The price is what motivated me to buy this, and I figured it would do the job until I learned to play and was ready to upgrade. Unfortunately, the buttons stick and there are other strange thip-thip noises produced by a couple of the reeds making it more or less useless. If it didn't have these problems it would be a great buy for the money; unfortunately it does. Back to square one!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs._B

customer_reviews.title: trinty college ap-20 anglo concertina
customer_reviews.text: do not buy this piece of Chinese junk. this is the worst $150 dollars i ever spent. the bellows is stiff as a board. sound is terrible. could not find any reviews before buying. hope this review helps any body thinking of buying this concertina. buyer beware----------
customer_reviews.author: C. bowers

customer_reviews.title: concertina
customer_reviews.text: mamas new sqeezebox a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a aa yyy h

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful instrument and great Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This concertina is built very well and is an excellent value for the price. It arrived correctly tuned and in perfect working order. A great beginner instrument and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: AD-BD

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. No sticking buttons
customer_reviews.text: High quality. No stucking buttons. Nice tone. Worth paying for and to start a beginner with a good instrument. Lovely appearance black and silver good color for young man.
customer_reviews.author: sienna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trad music
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to show up a (irish) trad session with a piano key accordion, so I took a chance on this inexpensive button accordion and am not disappointed one bit. Is it made of luxurious wood and pearl buttons? Nope. Doesn't need to be and the other session players would probably kick me out from bringing some souped up button accordion to what is supposed to be fun get-together making music. It plays well, no reed problems, no button sticking, finish is good, bellows are easy to work, and it's just a lot of fun to play. Oh and at this price point, there are no competitors. So get one and start having some fun.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A periodically inoperable concertina. 160.00 dollars of frustration. I will return,
customer_reviews.text: Keys continually get stuck and render the instrument unable to operate........ This was a gift for my son - very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas gift ever!
customer_reviews.text: The reaction of my son seeing this Christmas morning. .... worth every penny! He didn't put it down for an hour after he opened it. He studies music in school so right away he started identifying the various chords/notes. Sounds wonderful! My only complaint is that the hand straps are HUGE , my son is 17 and we had to make more holes in the straps to tighten it up enough for him to properly play it.
customer_reviews.author: Marilou D

product_meta.title: Trinity College AP-20 Diatonic 20-button Anglo Concertina,Red Pearloid
product_meta.description: Style:20 Button| Color:Red PearloidTrinity College Concertinas offer all the features and craftsmanship of the classic turn-of-the-century instruments but at moderate cost. These instruments are light weight, portable, easy to learn and fun to play. Trinity College Anglo Collection Concertinas feature a diatonic button system, which works much as a harmonica does. Each button produces two different pitches, one on the blow another on the draw. Though they can be played in other keys, they are mostly played in C or G. Harmony may be obtained by pushing more than one button at a time.
feature_bullets: 20 buttons, 2 1/2 octave range, air release button to close instrument noiselessly
End-plates covered in gleaming red pearloid
To learn more, please see our Product Description below
